h1.title: Convert PNG to JPG Online
h1.description: Free and fast PNG to JPG converter with high quality and smaller file sizes. Works instantly on any device — no signup required.

h2.title: Why Convert PNG to JPG?
h2.description:
PNG is great for graphics with transparency but can be heavy. JPG offers smaller files and wide compatibility:

  • Smaller File Sizes: Reduce storage and speed up page loads.
  • Better Compatibility: JPG works everywhere.
  • Photo-friendly: Ideal for photos and gradients.
  • Bandwidth Savings: Lighter images for mobile/web.

h2.title: How to Convert PNG to JPG Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload PNG and choose your file.
  2. Wait for processing.
  3. Click Download JPG to save your image.

Quality is auto-tuned for a strong balance of size and fidelity.

h2.title: Tips for Better Results
h2.description:
• Quality Setting: Use 85–90% for important images; 70–80% for web.
  • Transparency: PNG alpha becomes a solid background (default white) in JPG.
  • Resolution: Resize large images before converting to shrink files further.
  • Web Performance: After JPG, consider JPG → WebP for extra savings.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: PNG (image/png)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: JPG (.jpg, MIME image/jpeg)
  • Encoding: Progressive JPEG via mozjpeg

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Transparent areas: JPG has no alpha; background will be white. If you need transparency, keep PNG.
  • Color shift: Convert to sRGB before upload for consistent web display.
  • Still too large: Lower quality slightly (80–85%) or resize.
  • Upload fails: Ensure PNG and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Is this PNG to JPG converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, the converter is completely free with no hidden charges or subscriptions.

faq.question: Will I lose transparency when converting PNG to JPG?
faq.answer: Yes. JPG doesn’t support transparency, so transparent pixels become a solid background (default white).

faq.question: Will the image lose quality during conversion?
faq.answer: JPG uses lossy compression. We use high-quality settings to minimize visible loss.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Are my files safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed automatically and not retained longer than necessary for conversion.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple PNGs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process or use a batch tool.

faq.question: Can I use this tool on my phone?
faq.answer: Yes. The converter is mobile-friendly and works on iOS and Android browsers.

note: JPG conversion is lossy. Keep a copy of your original PNG if you may need lossless or transparency later.
